Text: This is your home base. It's a vertical compound that spans between Lower Underrail and lower caves.
This is your home base. It's a vertical compound that spans between Lower Underrail and lower caves.
Cave tunnels connecting SGS with the lower caves.
Caves containing series of small outposts once used by South Gate Station.
There is an intricate network of cave tunnels below, above and all around the Underrail metro system.
You can purchase weapons and armors from Lucas at the armory here, and also practice your gun skills at the shooting range.
Purchase food and gossip around in the cantina. Tanner's office is also on this level.
Vera's office is on this level.
This level contains the private quarters of many of the stations inhabitants, including yours.
You can get medical and psionic attention here.
This is where mechanical, electronic and computer engineering takes place. You can purchase related equipment here.
This is where the animals are kept and plants and fungi are grown. You can purchase various biological components here.
You can exit into the caves here or go to the docks.
The GMS compound used to belong to Omega station, before it was abandoned.
Old coal mining outpost that turned into a hunting camp.
Old coal mine.
You have a creepy feeling that someone is staring at you intensely from some dark corner as you move through these caves.
An old abandoned battery recycling plant.
From here you can set sail to Junkyard, Camp Hathor, and Core City.
Many smaller rivers and streams converge here to create one large body of water from which the river Celeritas springs.
You can hear the sound of water bubbling up all around you.
A scrappy settlement off the grid, built around, and from, an old junkyard. It's a dangerous place run by two rivaling gangs.
Controlled by ruthless Black Eels. From here you can set sail to South Gate Station, Camp Hathor and Core City.
The original junkyard. Now a dangerous place overrun by mutants.
Gate to the settlement known as Junkyard.
The largest city of the South Underrail. Formerly a Biocorp megalopolis, now ruled by an independent oligarchy.
Gates to Core City.
Entrance to the industrial town of Foundry.
This industrial complex, in addition of being a foundry, also houses its workers, as well as a number of traders and the renowned Foundry Guard.
People of Foundry extract valuable ore from these caverns.
Upper metro system of South Underrail. It used to connect mostly commercial, research and educational facilities.
Entrance to the Institute of Tchort, an esoteric sciento-religious community.
An esoteric sciento-religious community.
An old decrepit shopping center.
Old research lab, now used for... other purposes.
Entrance to an old research lab.
Old research lab, now used for... other purposes.
Biggest Protectorate outpost in South Underrail.
Lower metro system of South Underrail. It used to connect mostly industrial facilities.
Protectorate's outpost in the farthest south of Underrail.
A secluded metro station.
A small peaceful community.
This storage block is now occupied by Ironheads.
Old research lab, now used for... other purposes.
A network of utility passages sprawling underneath the lower metro system.
The eye of Underrail.
Old research lab, now used for... other purposes.
A weird out-of-the-way inn.
Abominable thing...
Large, often badly damaged, mutagen tanks litter this area.
Old decrepit Biocorp research complex. It seems to have met a gruesome end.
Caved-in passage.
Tchortists outpost in Deep Cavern.
Something very wrong seems to be going on in this lab.
What is this scrappy shack doing in this secluded part of Deep Caverns.
It seems to be still working in some capacity.
A series of storage facilities.
This old outpost has new residents.
There is a number of ruined residential buildings here.
Red beedy eyes in the darkness.
A system of small caves connected with narrow tunnels.
This is not right. Mushrooms should not be this big.
So it is true, there is a system of large caverns deep beneath Underrail.
Old abandoned Biocorp facility.
This is the base of operations for Free Drones.
You're not sure where you are...
Black Sea is a giant lake resting in the equally big cavern. This area is also known as Hell's Gut.
A secluded grotto.
There's a village of savage Black Sea natives here.
Something that you can only describe as an aura of evil weighs heavily upon you in this place.
This island is now home to a community of muties.
The waters here are very quick and treacherous.
The numerous stalagmites and stalactites here give jaw-like appearance to this passageway that leads to the Black Sea.
A group of Northerners have set up camp here.
This large makeshift port is home to the Black Sea pirates.
This large makeshift port is home to the Black Sea pirates.
This large makeshift port is home to the Black Sea pirates.
This large makeshift port is home to the Black Sea pirates. It seems to have been built around an old decrepit battleship.
It's overgrown with some type of reddish weed.
It's hard to image the creatures these bones once belonged to. Surely nothing this big exists anymore in the Black Sea.
One can indubitably sense a restless and malicious numen here.
There be pirates here.
The smaller of the two pirate ports.
Large waterfront of an old industrial complex.
A natural basalt cave.
This foul-smelling marsh is overrun with insects, snakes and other undesirables.
Entrance to some sort of high-tech facility.
The ground here is muddy and the area is littered with pools of boiling greenish water and active geysers.
The ground here is muddy and the area is littered with pools of boiling greenish water and active geysers. There's a facility here, though.
You can hear skittering all around you.
Due to all the automated combat machinery, you can also surmise that this is some sort of a military base.
It appears someone is living here.
Even by Core City standards this place is really stinky.
The circular waterway near the Core City is popularly called Core Ring.
The circular waterway near the Core City is popularly called Core Ring. Protectorate likes to set up its outposts there.
Too close to the Rig for pirates, but too far from it to get drawn into a bar fight - probably the safest part of any sail.
This pass separates the Core Ring from the Dreadpool.
This is as far as most people would dare sail.
This is the longest known navigable river in the south.
There are large numbers of hoppers and boars in these here caves.
Large platform made by Black Eels to control the nearby waterways and facilitate Junkyard trade.
Look out for pirates.
All the scrap that is traded out from Junkyard passes this way.
The infamous bay where the pirates fence off their stolen goods.
The remains of an old naval facility, intersected by numerous waterways.
The place for all your hopper racing needs!
A soaring, abandoned, deep-frozen tower.
